More information available at:
* '''<nowiki>[[UbuntuDevelopers|responsibilities, permissions and more information about Ubuntu Developers]]</nowiki>'''
* <nowiki>[[UbuntuDevelopment|more general information about Ubuntu Development]]</nowiki>

The Ubuntu Developer Membership Board operates on the following basis:

* The <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~developer-membership-board/+members|list of the Developer Membership Board members]]</nowiki> can be found on Launchpad. The term for DMB membership is 2 years.
* You can reach the board by emailing <nowiki>[[mailto:devel-permissions@lists.ubuntu.com|devel-permissions@lists.ubuntu.com]]</nowiki>. This mailing list is public (<nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/devel-permissions/|devel-permissions@ archives]]</nowiki>) and our general process and policy discussions are public; if exceptionally private communication is required, such as discussing the performance of an individual, then use the private list at <nowiki>[[mailto:developer-membership-board@lists.ubuntu.com|developer-membership-board@lists.ubuntu.com]]</nowiki>.
* Or you can discuss developer application matters on <nowiki>[[IRC]]</nowiki> at #ubuntu-devel.

== Application process ==
The Ubuntu Developer Membership Board currently approves <nowiki>[[UbuntuDevelopers#ContribDev|Contributing Developers]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu Membership),  <nowiki>[[UbuntuDevelopers#PerPackage|per-package uploaders]]</nowiki>,  <nowiki>[[UbuntuDevelopers#SRUDevelopers| SRU Developers]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[UbuntuDevelopers#MOTU|MOTU]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[UbuntuDevelopers#CoreDev|Core Developers]]</nowiki>. To apply, please follow <nowiki>[[DeveloperMembershipBoard-ApplicationProcess|this process]]</nowiki>.

The following changes <nowiki>[[http://irclogs.ubuntu.com/2009/10/13/%23ubuntu-meeting.html|were agreed on]]</nowiki>:
* <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/devel-permissions|devel-permissions@lists.ubuntu.com]]</nowiki> list will used
* invitations/applications go there as well as to relevant team list
* all approvals go to ubuntu-devel@ (meeting minutes) and devel-permissions@ (individual outcomes) (maybe also to the team list)

The implementation of the application process might vary across teams slightly, but we expect the following very general procedure:
* documentation, 
* declaring intent,
* discussion with applicant, 
* public announcement

== Delegation ==

<nowiki>[[UbuntuDevelopers-TeamDelegation|Team delegation procedure]]</nowiki>

The DMB currently delegated approval privileges to

* the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-desktop|Desktop team]]</nowiki> -- <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DesktopTeam/Developers|Policy]]</nowiki>
* the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~kubuntu-dev|Kubuntu team]]</nowiki> -- <nowiki>[[https://community.kde.org/Kubuntu/Developers|Policy]]</nowiki>
* the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~mythbuntu-dev|Mythbuntu team]]</nowiki> --<nowiki>[[http://www.mythbuntu.org/development/policy|Policy]]</nowiki>
* the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-kernel-uploaders|Kernel team]]</nowiki> -- <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Kernel/Dev/UploadRights|Policy]]</nowiki>

This delegation includes individual <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuDevelopers#PerPackage|per-package upload privileges]]</nowiki> for packages which are in the corresponding team package set.

== Meeting ==

The DMB currently meets every two weeks in <nowiki>[[irc:--irc.freenode.net-ubuntu-meeting|#ubuntu-meeting]]</nowiki> on Monday alternating between 13:00 UTC and 15:30 UTC. See <nowiki>[[Agenda|agenda]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[TeamReports|meeting minutes]]</nowiki>.
